oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Evaluation of the Stability and Performance of a Multi-Stage Riemann Solver in Relativistic Hydrodynamic Simulations
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sikorski, J.
Porter-Sobieraj, J.
Kikoła, D.
Słodkowski, M.
Aszklar, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nuclear Theory
Physics - Computational Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The work deals with assessing the quality of a multi-stage Riemann solver for relativistic hydrodynamic simulations of heavy-ion collisions. The physical system is described using hydrodynamic conservation laws and then solved numerically. Because of the nature of such hydrodynamic simulations the numerical method has to cope with problems containing both strong discontinuities and smooth solutions, and reproduce these features with a high precision and stability.
Comment: Cancellation of preprint version on the request of authors
